citation.article-title: Pontibacter actiniarum gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel member of the phylum 'Bacteroidetes', and proposal of Reichenbachiella gen. nov. as a replacement for the illegitimate prokaryotic generic name Reichenbachia Nedashkovskaya et al. 2003.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Reichenbachiella gen. nov. (previous illegitimate name Nedashkovskaya et al. 2003)

Reichenbachiella (Rei.chen.bach.i.el′la. N.L. fem. dim. n. Reichenbachiella named in honour of Hans Reichenbach, a German microbiologist who has made a great contribution to the taxonomy of bacteria belonging to the phylum ‘Bacteroidetes’).
Cytochrome oxidase-, catalase- and alkaline phosphatase-positive.
The major respiratory quinone is MK-7.
The main cellular fatty acids are straight-chain unsaturated and branched-chain saturated fatty acids C15 : 0 iso, C16 : 1ω5c and summed feature 3 (comprising C15 : 0 iso 2-OH and/or 16 : 1ω7c).
As determined by 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis, the genus Reichenbachiella is a member of the phylum ‘Bacteroidetes’.
The type species is Reichenbachiella agariperforans.
